bibl.title: Seals and Stamps as Identifiers in Greco-Roman Egypt.
Identifiers and Identification Methods in the Ancient World = Legal Documents in Ancient Societies. III

bibl.note: 1. Use of seals as identifiers in daily life: general context. - 2. Poor identifiers: small seals with figural device in the private sphere. - 3. Excellent identifiers: large seals with textual device in the commercial sphere. - 4. Solid stamps: authenticating seals and stamps issued by officials. - 5. Conclusions.
bibl.seg: Katelijn Vandorpe, Seals and Stamps as Identifiers in Greco-Roman Egypt.

Mark Depauw & Sandra Coussement (edd.), Identifiers and Identification Methods in the Ancient World = Legal Documents in Ancient Societies. III = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 229 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 141-151.

1. Use of seals as identifiers in daily life: general context. - 2. Poor identifiers: small seals with figural device in the private sphere. - 3. Excellent identifiers: large seals with textual device in the commercial sphere. - 4. Solid stamps: authenticating seals and stamps issued by officials. - 5. Conclusions.
